bullets.text: Minneapolis federal-agent killing videos contradict Trump officials, intensifying scrutiny and raising U.S. governance risk.
Shutdown odds rise as Senate GOP won’t remove DHS funding after Minneapolis killing, threatening federal operations and market confidence.
Gold tops $5,000/oz, signaling strong demand for safe havens amid geopolitical risk and uncertainty around rates.
Ahead of Fed meeting, futures soften while gold hits records; investors focus on duration of ‘higher-for-longer’ policy and Big Tech earnings.
Winter storms drive U.S. flight cancellations to pandemic-era levels, disrupting logistics, labor mobility, and near-term consumer spending.
Mississippi Delta farmers weigh letting crops rot as rice prices slump—highlighting farm-margin stress and potential knock-on effects for rural economies.
Canada signals no China free-trade push as Trump threatens 100% tariffs, raising North American trade-policy uncertainty and supply-chain reshoring pressure.
Xi’s military purge reportedly brings down China’s top general, underscoring internal control priorities that could affect readiness and regional security calculations.
Iran crackdown details, mass-casualty claims, and a two-week internet blackout show escalating repression, increasing sanctions risk and regional instability.
Venezuela families report detainees missing, pointing to deepening rule-of-law erosion that deters investment and complicates any economic normalization.
Apple reportedly to unveil Gemini-powered Siri, intensifying platform-level AI competition and raising stakes for ecosystem lock-in and on-device AI strategy.
40-year forest datasets show Amazon shifting, reinforcing climate-risk materiality for agriculture, insurance, and carbon markets.
